title: Command injection vulnerability via eval $(get_feature_paths) in speckit scripts
close_reason: Fixed command injection vulnerability by using printf %q for shell-safe quoting in get_feature_paths()

comments.author: kbrockhoff
comments.text:
**Source:** PR #4 review by Copilot (security)

**Affected Files:**
- .specify/scripts/bash/update-agent-context.sh:56
- .specify/scripts/bash/setup-plan.sh:31
- .specify/scripts/bash/check-prerequisites.sh:82

**Issue:** `eval $(get_feature_paths)` evaluates shell code constructed from CURRENT_BRANCH and other values, allowing command injection via malicious branch names. A branch named `001-bad'; rm -rf ~; echo 'x` would execute arbitrary commands.

**Fix:** Refactor to avoid eval on dynamically constructed text from git state. Options:
1. Have get_feature_paths set variables directly
2. Source a safely-quoted file
3. Use read with IFS parsing

title: update-agent-context.sh uses fragile while-read parsing for markdown sections
close_reason: Replaced fragile while-read loop with robust awk-based section processing

comments.author: kbrockhoff
comments.text:
**Source:** PR #4 review by gemini-code-assist (high)

**File:** .specify/scripts/bash/update-agent-context.sh:471

**Issue:** The while-read loop for updating agent files is complex and fragile. A small change in markdown structure (extra newline, sub-heading) could break the update logic.

**Suggested Fix:** Use more robust approach:
- awk or sed with address ranges to replace entire sections
- HTML-style comments as markers to delineate sections to update

title: git-branch sed pattern doesn't fully collapse multiple hyphens
close_reason: Fixed: replaced sed 's/--*/-/g' with tr -s '-' to properly collapse all consecutive hyphens

comments.author: kbrockhoff
comments.text:
**Source:** PR #4 review by gemini-code-assist (medium)

**File:** plugins/bkff-git/skills/git-branch/SKILL.md:107

**Issue:** `sed 's/--*/-/g'` doesn't correctly handle all cases of multiple hyphens (e.g., '----' becomes '--').

**Fix:** Use `tr -s '-'` instead:
```bash
SANITIZED=$(echo "$ISSUE_TITLE" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | sed 's/[^a-z0-9]/-/g' | tr -s '-' | cut -c1-30)
```

title: git-pr never uses PR template due to --body always being passed
close_reason: Fixed: now uses array-based command building and only passes --body when no PR template exists

comments.author: kbrockhoff
comments.text:
**Source:** PR #4 review by gemini-code-assist (critical)

**File:** plugins/bkff-git/skills/git-pr/SKILL.md:188

**Issue:** The GH_CMD variable is constructed on lines 184-186 but never executed. The actual command on line 188 unconditionally passes --body, which overrides any PR templates. The template check on line 141 and logic on line 186 have no effect.

**Fix:** Only provide --body flag if no template file is found. Use array-based command building:
```bash
CREATE_ARGS=('--title' "$CUSTOM_TITLE" '--base' "$MAIN_BRANCH")
[[ -n "$DRAFT_FLAG" ]] && CREATE_ARGS+=('--draft')
if [[ -z "$TEMPLATE_FILE" ]]; then
    PR_BODY=$(generate_pr_body)
    CREATE_ARGS+=('--body' "$PR_BODY")
fi
gh pr create "${CREATE_ARGS[@]}"
```
